definition: to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
to close down a business for good and put the best face on it (idiom)
last disciple of a master
to catch a thief by closing his escape route (idiom)

sentences.english: German schools, for instance, close at midday.
sentences.chinese: 例如，德国的学校在中午关门。

sentences.english: In recent months, more than two dozen sub-prime lenders have closed their doors.
sentences.chinese: 近来数月，二十四家以上的低收入贷款公司关门大吉。

sentences.english: Two other plants in the town have also closed.
sentences.chinese: 而镇上的另外两个工厂也同时关门大吉。

sentences.english: The reading room closes at 10 p.m .
Later, the hotel closed, Xiaoding recommendations to make snack stalls.
sentences.chinese: 晚了，饭店也关门了，小丁建议去小摊子上弄小吃。

sentences.english: The woodlands have hushed their songs, and doors are all shut at every house.
sentences.chinese: 林地里，歌声归于沉寂，家家户户都关门了。

sentences.english: The warehouse is closed for the annual stocktaking.
sentences.chinese: 仓库关门进行年度存货盘点。

sentences.english: Today, I was getting on a bus, the driver shut the door on me while I was half way inside.
sentences.chinese: 今天我坐公交车时，刚上到一半司机就关门了。

sentences.english: If you happen to be most night a home, don't just shut and not locked.
sentences.chinese: 你碰巧是最晚一个回家，别只关门而不上锁。

sentences.english: Toyota’s assembly plants reopened after being shut down for just two days.
sentences.chinese: 关门仅仅两天之后丰田的组装线就重新开动了。

sentences.english: I shut the door so heavily that it fell on my head.
sentences.chinese: 我关门那么重以致它掉到了我的头上。

sentences.english: Your 10 minutes of commercial-free headlines start right now! First up, government shutdown.
sentences.chinese: 首先让我们来看一下政府关门的问题。

sentences.english: He closed the door so hard that he wrenched the handle off.
sentences.chinese: 他关门用力过猛，边门把手也拧了下来。
六点半？那时候他们就关门了。

sentences.english: There is no door closing button. Press any floor button to close the landing door.
sentences.chinese: 这里没有关门按掣，按下任何楼层按钮以关闭机门。

sentences.english: Bob slammed his foot in the door.

definition: to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
to close shop in the evening/also pr. [da3 yang2]
to close down a business for good and put the best face on it (idiom)
to do business/to trade
to close/to shut
to go bankrupt/to close down
half-open door/fig. prostitute
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
outside the door
to lock the door
to lock/to lock up
the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
to go bankrupt/to become impoverished/bankruptcy
to open a business/first transaction of a business day
doorway/gate/CL:個|个[ge4]
